channel.title: First annual Black Mesa Haiku Contest
channel.description:
Remember it well, lads. Three lines of poetry (5 syllables, 7 syllables, 5 syllables, idiot. You learned it in fifth grade).
It doesn't have to rhyme, it does have to be about Black mesa. Go.
Checked the site today Still "four-two-eleven" on "news" forum. Shit.
----------------------------
Waiting for the mod Has become entertainment In itself, bitches.

item.title: First annual Black Mesa Haiku Contest
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Haiku can be 5-7-5 or 3-5-3.

Also, most people (including myself) get haiku wrong, at least, in the traditional sense, because it requires the juxtaposition of two images or ideas and drawing from nature.

So, something like this:

The Black Mesa Mod
Waiting for the awesomeness
The sun shines brightly

(And -phile is one syllable)[/SIZE]

Read full topic
item.source: First annual Black Mesa Haiku Contest

item.title: First annual Black Mesa Haiku Contest
item.dc:creator: UrBY
item.description:
uk_sniper:

Haiku’s are easy
But sometimes they dont make sense
refridgerator

Probably shouldn’t have lol’d so much at that…

razorbeamz:

An ARG for a mod?
Maybe Black Mesa?
That was a joke, ha, fat chance

Well you did that wrong. :meh:

Haiku: 5 syllables, 7 syllables, 5 syllables.

Posting in haiku.
Not as easy as it seems.
Now you try at home.

Read full topic

item.description:
I cut down trees. I eat my lunch.
I go to the lavatory.
On Wednesdays I go shoppin’
And have buttered scones for tea.

(fuck haiku’s, this song rocks. 'bout time we have an internet sing-along)

item.title: First annual Black Mesa Haiku Contest
item.dc:creator: BrAndi
item.description:
calhoun freeman:

Internet sarcasm is basically nonexistent as sarcasm depends on the tone of the voice…

Basically what Ram showed.

A wrong statement based on a correct observation.

Although the internet does lack acoustic communication and thus no tone of voice is transmitted, acoustic prosody is not the only prosody in existence.
There are things like lexical prosody, orthographic prosody, semantic prosody etc.

That means that sarcasm and irony can very well be used on the internet, although it is much more difficult to employ.

Example orthographic prosody: Wow ramnitaator y yo pics so much funy.
(Using bad orthography and grammar, thus acting like a retard, thus something liked by a retard is retarded and not funy probably = main message got reversed = sarcasm/irony)

Example lexical prosody: Fellow Raminator: That picture conveyed a superb message indeed.
(Using stilted register and archaic words on a board = hyperbole = possible irony/sarcasm)

Example semantic prosody: That picture certainly spread an important message.

(Using a verb usually followed by negative nouns like rumour, desease etc. = contradicting main message (“important”) = irony/sarcasm.

I am off for a well deserved fap.

Read full topic

item.description:
calhoun freeman:

Internet sarcasm is basically nonexistent as sarcasm depends on the tone of the voice…

calhoun freeman:

I DO NOT CARE ABOUT BLACK MESA

WHEN IS BALCK MEAS COMING OUT

You’ve just proven the existence of internet sarcasm and internet irony in one post.
